DOC.brief_summary: The study hypothesis is that chemotherapy of irinotecan and gemcitabine will improve local control of cancer and prolong survival in patients with inoperable biliary tract cancer.
DOC.brief_title: Irinotecan, Gemcitabine, Chemotherapy for Biliary Tract Cancer
DOC.criteria: Histologically or cytologically confirmed inoperable biliary tract cancer Age: 18 ~75 years old Performance status: ECOG 02 Hematopoietic: Granulocyte count at least 1,500/mm3 Platelet count at least 100,000/mm3 Hepatic: Bilirubin No greater than 2 fold the upper normal limit AST/ALT : No greater than 3 fold the upper normal limit Renal: Creatinine no greater than 1.5 mg/dL Not pregnant No other serious medical or psychiatric illness that would preclude giving informed consent or limit No prior chemotherapy within 6 months No other concurrent anticancer radiotherapy within 6 months
